subject: Marketing
title: The Free Tier Trap
description: A short lesson to help you apply The Free Tier Trap.

hook.text: Dropbox gives 2GB free. That tiny taste converted 4 million users to paid plans.

buildup.text: Free tiers work by creating dependence. Users invest data, habits, and identity.

discovery.text: The psychology of 'free' eliminates risk and activates the endowment effect.

twist.text: The free tier isn't generousâ€”it's calculated. The switching cost rises with every file saved.

climax.text: By the time users hit the limit, leaving feels more expensive than upgrading.

punchline.text: Free is the most expensive price to compete with.

quiz.question: Why are free tiers effective at driving paid conversions?
options: They create dependence and raise switching costs over time
Free users never actually need more features
They reduce the company's marketing budget
